newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Shell, Petronas sign oil pacts.
newsitem.headline: Shell, Petronas sign oil pacts.

text.p: Royal Dutch Shell on Friday signed three production sharing contracts with Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas) to explore for oil offshore Malaysian Borneo.

Under a 50/50 production sharing contract with Petronas exploration unit, Petronas Carigali Sdn Bhd, Shell will explore for oil on a 4,100-sq km block in the prolific petroleum bearing Baram delta province.
A second block covers an onshore area of 1,650 square km and an offshore area of 12,104 square km and is located on and off the Borneo state of Sabah.
A third zone is a deep water block in a relatively unexplored area of Sabah.
Both contractors have agreed to make a financial commitment of 45 million ringgit for each of the first two blocks and 25 million ringgit for the deep water block.
Shell has an 80 percent of the equity in the two Sabah blocks.

"The three PSCs (production sharing contracts) we signed today have one common characteristic," said Shell Malaysia chairman and chief executive Megat Zaharuddin Nor. "They cover areas which have been explored to varying degress; extensively in the case of Block SK-307 (Sarawak) and Block SB-301 (Sabah), and to a lesser extent in Block J (deepwater)."
"All areas are proven hydrocarbon provinces, where established plays are largely creamed of hydrocarbons. And therein, I believe, lies the very challenge itself," he said.
